title: The Morris Worm
description: A fast breakdown of The Morris Worm for builders.

hook.text: On November 2, 1988, the internet slowed to a crawl. Something was eating all the bandwidth.

buildup.text: Robert Morris, a Cornell grad student, released a self-replicating program to measure the internet.

discovery.text: A bug made the worm copy itself too aggressively, infecting machines over and over.

twist.text: About 10% of all internet-connected computers â€” roughly 6,000 â€” were knocked offline.

climax.text: Morris became the first person convicted under the Computer Fraud and Abuse Act.

punchline.text: An experiment to measure the web nearly killed it.

quiz.question: What was the Morris Worm originally intended to do?
options: Measure the size of the internet
